channel.title: How to create a Virtual Private Server (VPS) using Sun Microsystem's VirtualBox

item.title: How to create a Virtual Private Server (VPS) using Sun Microsystem's VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS
item.description:
@Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP wrote:

delmarvascape:

it says there is no bootable medium found when i start the server thingy

You need the ISO file. Google a free linux OS or use thepiratebay to find Windows ISO’s.

Read full topic

item.title: How to create a Virtual Private Server (VPS) using Sun Microsystem's VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Kingen50cent, post:5, topic:327511”][quote author=Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS link=topic=423898.msg3113888#msg3113888 date=1264801200]

Okay dude nice vid, but i am having a problem. Will this basically give you a free vps for a server? so you can host your server for free? instead of needing to buy a vps?

Yea, but when you shut off your computer, it will go off as well.
[/quote]

So whats the point of it?
i mean you can’t have anything 24/7…with this…it’s just a joke lmao[/quote]

lol then dont shut down your computer my computer is always 24/7 and i never close it off (except for a power outage or something) this just makes it so people can connect faster to your computer i guess.
this just makes it so it takes only a certain amount of space from your RAM or w/e you want, and it doesn’t have any connections or something so i guess you can use it to make people connect faster.

Read full topic

@delmarvascape wrote:

dude if you leave your comp on 24/7 then its 24/7? thats what i thought you had to do with a vps anyways so its not bad news to me. thanks man! :D…oh and in your video. whered u get that iso file at and whats in it

Read full topic

item.title: How to create a Virtual Private Server (VPS) using Sun Microsystem's VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @Kingen50cent Kingen50cent
item.description:
@Kingen50cent wrote:

Nothing is for free bro,
If you have 1GB of ram in your computer
And The virtual box (For EXAMPLE) will need 512MB of that 1GB which will leave you 512MB Left to use on your computer and 512MB to use at the virtual box private server.

So it will like ask you how much ram it should take and such stuff.

Read full topic
